hints.content:
To find the number of mice the $\maroonD{\text{Second snake}}$ caught, we start with the number of mice the $\goldE{\text{First Snake}}$ caught and subtract $\blueE{5}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cbdb9b90739152d9cfa835d9ecd8a5bd94b3bead)

$\goldE{12} - \blueE{5} = \maroonD{\Box}$

Let's subtract to find how many mice the $\maroonD{\text{Second snake}}$ caught.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5b4156d1e9e7c3eefda1b27cc40f82540007d04c)

$\goldE{12} - \blueE{5} = \maroonD{7}$

question.content:
One snake caught $12$ mice. 

Another snake caught $5$ fewer mice than the first.

**How many mice did the second snake catch?**

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] mice
